|Title=Knowing the clinical signs suggestive of an acute thyrotoxic crisis
|Description=None
|Rubric=Identification of the emergency
|Contributors=Dr Camille Buffet,Dr Magalie Haissaguerre
|Order=4}}

It is exceptional, occurring mainly after thyroidectomy in the absence of medical preparation. It is an exacerbation of the symptoms of hyperthyroidism, with fever, dehydration, cardiovascular and neuropsychological disorders that can be life-threatening.

question.question: What is an acute thyrotoxic crisis?
question.option_a: A sudden onset of hyperthyroidism symptoms after thyroid surgery
question.option_b: A severe exacerbation of hyperthyroidism symptoms, including fever, dehydration, cardiovascular and neuropsychological disorders
question.option_c: A rare complication of hyperthyroidism treated with radioactive iodine
question.option_d: A chronic condition caused by long-term exposure to excessive thyroid hormones
